column3: The perfect last supper in Rome
column4: My best friend and I found this restaurant by accident. It was our last day in Rome and we wanted to celebrate a fine vacation with a matching fine meal so we headed out to Trastavere at lunchtime to randomly find a place. It was the many locals sitting around, chatting and having lunch that drew us in. We made the right decision picking this restaurant: the staff was very charming, very Italian and very helpful (and they spoke fluent English). They didn't mind translating the entire menu for us (twice) and they convinced me to try a meal that I probably wouldn't have chosen otherwise (octopus sandwich) which turned out to be delightful. The menu is not too long and offers mostly fish/seafood-based traditional, but not commonly known meals (at least for tourists), so we especially enjoyed that we ate traditional, delicious Italian food that was still special and new. All in all, come here for the warm, funny and professional service, the friendly, local atmosphere and if you want to try food that's not that mainstream yet easy to appreciate for anyone. The prices won't break the bank either (entr√© 5 eur, main dishes from 10-15). Grazie for a perfect last meal! :)
